product_requests.description: A tool that takes natural language prompts describing an app's backend needs and automatically builds and deploys a full backend stack on robust cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS), providing a scalable and efficient alternative to simpler backend services.
product_requests.pain_point: Existing backend services (like Supabase) are often slow or lack the real backend architecture needed for scalable applications, and manually setting up complex cloud infrastructure is time-consuming and difficult.

tweets.text:
Imagine there would exist a tool where you can prompt what your app is all about and it would build and deploy your full backend stack on aws using aws infra.

Connect it to your #lovable app and instead of slow supabase backend you get a real backend architecture on aws.

product_requests.description: An AI-powered tool that identifies viral content (e.g., Reddit posts) within a specific niche, analyzes the underlying reasons for its success, and assists users in rewriting or generating similar content tailored for their target audience.
product_requests.pain_point: Difficulty in identifying successful content strategies, understanding the mechanics of virality, and efficiently generating engaging content that resonates with a specific audience.
product_requests.target_audience: Content Creators, Marketers, Social Media Managers, Community Managers

tweets.text:
What if there was a tool that:

– Found the exact Reddit posts that went viral in your niche
– Broke down why they worked
– Helped you rewrite them for your audience

I’m building it.

Would you use it?

product_requests.description: A universal tool that profiles software builds across any language or build system to identify performance bottlenecks, underutilized hardware, redundant compilations, and misconfigured targets, providing actionable insights for optimization.
product_requests.pain_point: Slow build times, inefficient resource utilization during development, and the difficulty in diagnosing and resolving build-related performance issues across diverse programming environments.
product_requests.target_audience: Software Developers, DevOps Engineers, Build Engineers

tweets.text:
Is a build profiling tool something that people would be interested in? I've been working on one for myself, and I'm trying to decide if it's worth making nice and releasing. 

Works on any language/build system. Checks for issues like under utilized hardware, files compiled multiple times, misconfigured targets... May eventually help you transition build systems.
@Sebasti66855537 Yeah nsight is generally the way to go for this kind of thing, or sometimes PIX. The only annoying part is having to do a build every time I make a change.

product_requests.description: An AI-powered tool that helps job seekers by clarifying ambiguous job descriptions, identifying key requirements, and providing tailored preparation materials for interviews, while also managing multiple job applications to reduce overwhelm.
product_requests.pain_point: Unclear or keyword-heavy job descriptions, difficulty understanding company expectations for interviews, and the challenge of keeping track of and preparing for numerous job applications simultaneously.

tweets.text:
I’m starting a new project. 

I'm calling it new but it's not actually a new one. It was just a tool I made for myself.

I came out with this project because It was time I was looking for a job and had difficulties preparing for my job interview.

The problem I found was that a lot of job interviews were unclear, with a bunch of keywords, and sometimes we don’t even understand the bottom of what the company is looking for.

+ When you are looking for a new job, you apply to many different jobs, so it’s hard to keep up.

So I'm coming up with the solutions for it !

product_requests.description: A specialized search engine or platform designed to provide high-quality, relevant results for niche topics, obscure forums, and personal websites, counteracting the 'enshittification' of general search engines.
product_requests.pain_point: Frustration with the declining quality and SEO-manipulation of mainstream search results, making it difficult to find specific, niche, or less commercialized information online.
product_requests.target_audience: Researchers, Niche Enthusiasts, Developers, Anyone seeking specific or non-commercial information

tweets.text: @sean_gause Doesn't help that Google has enshittified their search engine beyond repair in the name of SEO and AI so even if there was someone with the same/similar idea 15 years ago in an obscure forum, good luck finding it...
@DionysianAgent we need an index website to scorge through peoples personal sites. How it always should have been
Yes. We need some kind of open source thematic encyclopedia: Share the outputs/results, browser incorporated. No need for everyone to have to reinvent the wheel every morning.

ni yo uso ideascraper!!  😔

ayer estaba buscando en google: site:reddit. com "is there a tool for" + [nicho], abro el post , vuelvo a la busqueda.

eso es lo que tiene que hacer 🧩 ideascraper.
debeser un buscador de oportunidades...que ademas genera ideas https://t.co/UpG2Rh85bO

product_requests.description: An AI-powered system that monitors a developer's project directories, analyzes project status (e.g., abandoned, near completion, undocumented), prompts for necessary actions (e.g., documentation, task creation), and automates workflows to ensure projects progress efficiently.
product_requests.pain_point: Project stagnation, lack of consistent documentation, difficulty in tracking the true status of multiple development projects, and the manual effort required to manage project lifecycle tasks.
product_requests.target_audience: Software Developers, Project Managers (in dev teams), Indie Developers

tweets.text:
This got me thinking... How could I do something similar to start automating my stuff? 
What would it even do?

Some thoughts, besides basic content stuff... Monitor my projects directory and analyze all projects to get a status. Follow up with me to find out if they're abandoned or not, then move those out. Find those that are almost complete, and determine how to get them to that point quickly. Find those that have yet to be documented and ask questions to build out the prd. Send tasks for review, then start building when approved. Things would keep moving, and projects should hopefully start wrapping up.

product_requests.description: An industry-specific geo-spatial tool that integrates live building plans, site plans, and geographical data, allowing construction and service professionals to store information, attach notes and pictures, and visualize policies/updates geographically for daily operations, storm work, and insurance claims.
product_requests.pain_point: Disjointed tools for site management, difficulty integrating geographical data with building plans, and the lack of a unified platform for real-time site information and policy visualization in the construction and service industries.
product_requests.target_audience: Construction Professionals, Field Service Businesses, Insurance Adjusters, Urban Planners

tweets.text:
Wouldn’t it be cool to have active industry specific gps… and site plan creation tools.

Tired of people asking me all the apps I use… so I’m building the industry’s first gps that integrates actual building plans and other site plans into a live use case app. Meaning. 

Store information geographically and in the standard app directories. Leave notes, attach pics, all that. 

Storm work and insurance claims will benefit from this too but the day to day operations of TCi service businesses is my main target.

The solution?
Tools that put every team on the same page.
You should be able to:
✔️ See policies in effect right now
✔️ Spot overlays or pending plans
✔️ Visualize updates in one place

Clarity speeds things up.
#development #highrise #lowrise #missingmiddle

product_requests.description: A skill-based matching platform (like 'Tinder for builders') where individuals list their technical skills and project interests, enabling them to find and connect with compatible co-founders or team members based on skill overlap and shared goals.
product_requests.pain_point: Difficulty in finding suitable co-founders or team members with specific skill sets, the often 'closed' nature of builder communities, and the inefficiency of traditional networking for startup team formation.
product_requests.target_audience: Entrepreneurs, Software Developers, Designers, Startup Founders

tweets.text:
Weekend ideation:

There should be a Tinder for builders.
- People list their skills (TypeScript, Python,etc.)
- Set a match threshold (e.g. 70% overlap)
- Swipe to match with others based on skill sets.
and boom
Teams form organically
Even hiring would become easier. 

Thoughts?

The builder community is extremely closed individually. 
I regularly reach out to people and ask how they did x or y.
Just to get an idea how they solved their problems and I can tinker a bit or solve a similar problem for myself.

Out of all my approaches 0% have given any information. 

What are you afraid of?
@Jason I built a Roomate matching tool by scraping Facebook groups and semantically matching them. It wouldn’t be too hard to switch it to a co founder database!
@Jason Check @ycombinator co-founder matching tool, it's the best so far.

product_requests.description: A meta-AI tool that acts as a single, intelligent interface to multiple underlying AI models, automatically selecting the best model for a given task and providing a unified, simplified answer, thereby reducing the 'paradox of choice' and complexity of using numerous AI tools.
product_requests.pain_point: Overwhelm from the sheer number of available AI tools, difficulty in choosing the most appropriate tool for a specific task, and the desire for a simplified, consolidated AI experience.
product_requests.target_audience: AI Users (general), Knowledge Workers, Small Businesses

tweets.text:
Too many AI tools, too many choices. 

We need one tool that just gives us the answer and figures out the best model behind the scenes.

Anyone building this?

TIL no. 49: paradox of choice

there are way way way to many dev tools doing extremely similar things, advocating for minor differences, and desiring lock-in. 

building @withduckyAI has gone from a simple proof of concept that i thought i could whip up in a weekend to a headache in deciding what to build it with. 

now, its still a pretty simple idea and the architecture behind is relatively simple but that’s not what i learned, it’s that there are so many tools that implement these architectural patterns that make it difficult to truly pick one and build with it. 

i’m well aware of migrations and switching tools but that’s so much of a hassle. i just want one tool that does everything i want lol. i want personalized production grade software.

product_requests.description: A tool that generates detailed property descriptions and comprehensive prospects (including property condition and content-wise information) solely from images, with the ability for human review and editing, streamlining the listing and marketing process for real estate.
product_requests.pain_point: The manual and time-consuming process of creating detailed property descriptions, difficulty in accurately capturing and conveying property state from images, and the need for efficient content generation for real estate listings.
product_requests.target_audience: Real Estate Agents, Property Managers, Real Estate Marketers

tweets.text:
not yet, this is on the agenda, trying to figure out what market(s) I personally know best and can start in since it differs a lot. 

Main pain point from talking around seems to be the detailed property description, both internal and getting accurate information on the state of the property from both an descriptive but also content wise. 

main goal here is a complete prospect generated from images alone. with the ability for a human to review/edit.
